bug.short_desc: Add support for SVG plug-in detection

long_desc.thetext:
Qooxdoo has introduced native SVG detection for a while now (since 0.7, if memory isn't failing me). That's fine enough for nowadays browsers, specially since IE9 has introduced native SVG support as well.
Enterprise-level applications (an area where qooxdoo is particularly good at) unfortunately don't usually work with the latest browser versions, and things like IE6 will still be "in the wild" for a few years.
Regarding SVG support, to try addressing that, I'd propose integrating into the framework detection for ASV (Adobe SVG Viewer), the most widely-used plug-in for SVG support, which even used to work in several browsers (but its support has broke with browser evolution and native support, which was a Good thing).
The use case for this is determining when a browser has native SVG support, using qx.core.Environment.get("html.svg"), and resort to plug-in detection before failing.
What do you think? I've even quickly mashed-up a prototype implementation, based in the bug's URL code (see "hasPluginSVG" method) and would like to know whether a git push was appropriate or a "plain" patch was preferred. :-)
Move open issues to RESOLVED – LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
